results.creator_credit: R. Ronald Brown, Michel Laloride, Gerald Wilson, Christopher Tate and Century II Motion Pictures

results.title: Fonteyn and Nureyev: The perfect partnership
results.creator_credit: Peter Batty and Peter Batty Productions
results.brief_description: Narrated by Robert Powell, this is the remarkable story of the unique dancing collaboration of Margot Fonteyn and Rudolph Nureyev that brought joy to millions around the world. Thought by many to be the most sensational partnership ever, it is certainly one against which all others will be judged. Theirs was a collaboration of two very contrasting personalities. Fonteyn, an experienced ballerina, idolized already for her own achievements and for whom stardom seemed an effortless progression. Nureyev, half her age and relatively unknown, had to thrust his way into a dancing career against the advice of family and friends. This wonderful voyage through their careers together is filled with the opinions and reminisces of the friends and contemporaries and some rare and intimate footage of the perfect partners. It includes performances from the ballets; Romeo and Juliet, Le Corsaire, Giselle, Swan Lake, Marguerite and Armand, Les Sylphides, Birthday Offering, Hamlet Prelude and Lucifer.

results.title: A Matter of communication (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
FOCUS looks at the difficulties experienced by many migrants in understanding the Anglo-Saxon legal system and investigates the way people are treated at the hands of the law. A Vietnamese man in condemned for killing a dog for consumption and a Lebanese man allegedly is bashed by police.

results.title: Two Different Worlds (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A story of children challenging the attitudes of their migrant parents and growing apart from their discipline and culture. The repercussions of holding two standards - that of their parents and that of the new Australian society. How do they cope with two values.

results.title: The Kamikaze of industry (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A study of Workers’ Compensation. Some migrant workers have been described as the ‘kamikaze of industry’. They have also been accused of being compo-cheats. Is the label justified?

results.title: Fontane Effi Briest = Effi Briest
results.creator_credit: Rainer Werner Fassbinder, Filverlag der Authoren and Tango Film
results.brief_description: Possibly Fassbinder’s most exquisite film, this is the story of a seventeen year old girl stifled in a loveless marriage, too naive to understand that her liaison with one of her husband’s friends risks bringing disaster on both of them. Using carefully stylised visuals and performances, Fassbinder produces not a conventional literary adaptation but a searching study of the ways that people can unwittingly conspire in their own downfall. From the novel by Theodor Fontane. In German with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rainer Werner Fassbinder, Filverlag der Authoren and Tango Film

results.title: Just who's prejudiced? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A look at the claim that some migrant Australians will not associate with Anglo-Saxon Australians because they lack ‘culture’. Is there such a thing as an ‘Ocker Aussie?’

results.title: Love by arrangement (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Gordon Bick and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
Looks at traditional arranged marriages carried out in Australia by various migrant groups. Presents interviews with members of the Muslim and English communities, discussing their views on arranged marriage and the selection of prospective partners.

results.title: Carry on up the Khyber (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Peter Rogers Productions and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
It is 1895 and the British occupation of India is threatened by revolutionary uprisings. In order for the revolutionaries to attack the British troops they need to cross the notorious Khyber Pass. The history and politics of the British Raj, however, is simply a convenient background for the Carry On team to conduct their regular mix of hilarious slap-stick and tongue-in-cheek camp. Cast includes Sidney James, Kenneth Williams, Joan Sims and a large supporting cast of British comedians.

results.title: Carry on doctor
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
Britain’s favourite comedy team “carry on” as they only know how! “Carry on Doctor” looks at life in a country hospital when the patients revolt against the staff. Hattie Jacques is the fearsome Matron, Kenneth Williams the cold-hearted Doctor Tinkle, while Sid James as the malingerer Mr. Roper, takes a vacation in hospital. A madcap romp of bandages and stethescopes, Frankie Howard as Mr. Bigger hams it up while Charles Hawtrey gives an unforgettable performance as an expectant father suffering all the symptoms of pregnancy.
